Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Sherds
Description: Sherds of a hemispherical bowl made of a fine clay, red with a black rim. The Exterior has been polished, the interior smoothened. The decoration is typical Old Kerma: vertical bands impressed with a serrated roller stamp and incisions emphasising the lip.
